title: Help about SK Telecom Copyright on Youtube recently
body:
hey so few days ago a youtube video i uploaded from peanut stream got striked by SK telecom and i had to delete it which is fine. And i have a few more videos of skt uploaded but they are all spectated through op.gg so they are all replays. And I got an email saying this:

"Hello, this is xx, who is in charge of SKT T1 Videos Copyrights.

I am here to inform you about your illegal usages of SKT T1's copyrights.

Not only SKT T1's copyrights include its emblems and its players' photos, but also they include the players' highlight/montage videos, streams, and any other VODs related to SKT T1.

Even the Riot Games, who has the control over fan-created League of Legends contents, officially stated that actions to gain profit by making video contents of any teams' players are prohibited. We already requested Riot Games copyright protection for all SKT T1's spectate videos. Also, Riot Games acknowledged that SKT T1 has the copyright over its players' spectate videos.

Moreover, your actions violate Republic of Korea's Right of Publicity and copyright laws. If you continue to create and upload more videos of SKT T1, we inform you that the law can take legal actions against your actions.

Therefore, we ask you to delete the remaining videos of SKT T1's player.

If you do not delete the video until this week, Riotgames will take action directly. "

So im wondering if I should delete all skt related stuff now such as replays or maybe even highlights of the LCK streams. Anyone has any idea ?

replies.body: Why would you think you could upload a video to youtube from somebody else's stream?
Its also ingame replays through op.gg for other youtubers. SOOO no clue why people would be allowed to upload replays. Maybe you can explain Mr r.

Okay, why would you think you should be able to record someone else's gameplay and upload it to youtube without their consent?

Anyway, here's a simple guide to copyrights:

Did I create this?
If not, then I have no legal right to profit off of it. Additionally, if the person who did create it intends to profit off of it, it's well within their rights to protect their creation.

Pressing record on Fraps doesn't count as creation, neither does creating highlight reels.
Ok if im in game with faker and i record the replay of it afterwards im fucked. rip. Does def. belog to skt not riot my bad

If you're in a game with faker, then it would be gameplay that you created.

"Watch me play versus Faker" is a lot different than "Watch Faker play" how can you not understand this?
btw mr genius. it turned out to be fake, its not the real SKT striking Videos.

I'm not part of the legal team, so I can't really speak on legal liabilities.  Per our [Legal gibber jabber](http://www.riotgames.com/legal-jibber-jabber) policy, we are okay with a lot of things as long as there isn't unpermitted monetary gains.  My suggestion would be to send an email about this to info@riotgames.com.  We'll field your question to the proper team to help you out with this individually.  Hope that helps!
